stories.title: McDonald to circumvent San Francisco's Happy meal ban by charging for toy

stories.text:
I'm a tech co founder turned coach, and run a programme that helps people rethink their relationship with work.

The majority of applicants are overwhelmingly engineers, and some of the things they say about their work I believe is maybe representative of a big shift.

> "I feel like cattle being trading at a market"

> "I'm a resource, not a human"

> "My only value is seemingly my ability to build"

Wondering if this resonates with anyone here? Has the pandemic changed anyone else's perception of their work as an engineer? Anyone actively thinking about changing careers from engineering too?

Is there anything you want from your work as an engineer that you're seemingly not getting?

Would love to hear of some more of peoples changing experiences as software engineers, and if the pandemic has catalysed any shifts.
stories.title: How does it FEEL being a software engineer?
Survival of Salmonella in Mayonnaise and Other Raw Egg Products

stories.text:
Dear Community,

I have a problem with Google handling my GDPR request. Before forwarding this issue to my lawyer and notifying my local data privacy authority, I want to try my luck here.

The issue is that it is impossible to delete Google Calendar entries permanently. Even if not visible in the Calendar (and dust bin) anymore, those entries are still visible in Google Takeout with the status "CANCELLED".

How to reproduce: 1. Create a calendar entry 2. Delete that calendar entry 3. Empty the dust bin 4. Download your Google Calendar entry via Google Takeout 5. The calendar entry is still visible, so it must be stored on Google servers still.

I tried contact the support multiple times and also asked them to escalate this case, which was done. But in the end I always receive a generic answer that I should delete my cookies and cache and try again. If that does not work, I should fill out the Google Takeout feedback form.

Has someone else had the same issue? How should I proceed to get my data deleted?
stories.title: Google Calendar GDPR Violation
